title: Alcaraz overcomes leg problem and Zverev at Aussie Open
desc: Carlos Alcaraz fought through a leg issue to deliver a 6-4 7-6 (7-5) 6-7 (3-7) 6-7 (4-7) 7-5 win over Alexander Zverev and reach his first Australian Open final, with the Spaniard somehow managing to keep his career Grand Slam bid alive.

title: Carlos Alcaraz reaches first Australian Open final after escaping Alexander Zverev in seesaw match
desc: Alcaraz led 2-0, 4-4 when he appeared to hurt his upper-right leg stretching for a volley. He still came back to win an epic.

title: Leopardstown to face inspection for Saturday's action
desc: The first day of the Dublin Racing Festival needs to survive a 2.30pm inspection on Friday due to heavy rainfall overnight.

title: A Guide to Its Scientific Research Potential
desc: Explore the scientific potential of the research peptide CJC-1295 DAC. Learn about its role in studies on cellular aging, metabolism, and neuroprotection.

title: Jamie Carragher leaps to defence of 'underrated' Raheem Sterling with ex-Man City & Chelsea winger backed for 'fitting finale'
desc: Jamie Carragher has sought to defend Raheem Sterling from any criticism, following his release by Chelsea, with the England international considered to be seriously “underrated”. The Premier League title-winning ex-Manchester City star is now looking for a new challenge at 31 years of age, with a former team-mate from his days at Anfield hoping that a “fitting finale” to a distinguished career can be found.

title: Jamie Carragher leaps to defence of 'underrated' Raheem Sterling with ex-Man City & Chelsea winger backed for 'fitting finale'

title: Malaysia's ZUS Coffee expands into Thailand, eyes 50 outlets by 2026
desc: BANGKOK: Malaysian coffee chain ZUS Coffee plans to open 50 outlets in Thailand in 2026, following its official debut in the Kingdom on Friday.

title: Villarreal coach slams Thomas Partey over performance in defeat to Leverkusen
desc: Villarreal coach Marcelino García Toral did not hold back in his criticism of Ghanaian midfielder Thomas Partey following the defeat to Bayer Leverkusen in the Champions League.

title: Who Arsenal Could Face in the 2025-26 Champions League Round of 16
desc: The Gunners are poised for another deep Champions League run this season.
